intro: Gentiana compacta, commonly known as the dwarf gentian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Gentiana compacta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
